results.title: Eat the rich
results.creator_credit: Peter Richardson, Tim Van Rellim and Ironfist Pictures
results.brief_description: From the makers of the “Comic strip” and the “Young Ones”, this black and often tasteless comedy is certain to startle. Alex, a black waiter at a celebrated restaurant for the rich called “Bastards”, is sacked. Determined to wreak revenge, he organises a people’s take over and captures the restaurant. Renaming it “Eat the Rich”, Alex and his friends serve up their own special brand of millionaires mince. Not for the faint-hearted and with a heavy metal soundtrack by Motorhead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Richardson, Tim Van Rellim and Ironfist Pictures

results.title: The Krays
results.creator_credit: Peter Medak, Ray Burdis, Dominic Anciano and Fugitive Features
results.brief_description: Growing up in the East End of London during World War 2, the Kray twins became the heads of London’s gangster underworld in the 1960’s. After their release from prison during their teens, the Krays consolidated their underworld connections and “The Firm” was born. Ruling through fear, extortion and violence, the Kray’s empire dominated the crime world for years. Finally in 1969, they were convicted of murder and separated in prison. At their beloved mother’s death in 1982, they were briefly reunited before returning to prison. A compelling film biography.

results.title: High spirits
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, David Saunders, Stephen Woolley, Palace Pictures and Vision pdg
results.brief_description: A desperate Peter Plunkett (Peter O’Toole) endeavours to save his crumbling Irish ancestral castle threatened with foreclosure by turning it into a hotel with a difference. Peter and his loyal staff create a supernatural fantasy to lure American tourists. All hell breaks loose when Jack (Steve Guttenberg), a married American, falls in love with Mary (Daryl Hannah), a gorgeous ghost. This prompts the real ghosts of Plunkett castle to wreak havoc. An hilarious, ghoulish, supernatural farce with collapsing sets and wind machine action. Cast members complained that the producers crudely altered the original whimsical intentions of writer-director Neil Jordan. Cast includes Beverley D’Angelo, Liam Neeson, Peter Gallagher, Jennifer Tilly, Ray McAnally, Martin Ferrero, Donal McCann, Connie Booth, Liz Smith and Mary Coughlan.

results.title: Thumbelina
results.creator_credit: Gary Goldman, Don Bluth, John Pomeroy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hans Christian Andersen’s classic fairy tale tells the story of a tiny girl called Thumbelina. One magical night she meets Prince Cornelius, an enchanted fairy as tiny as herself, and she is sure she has found true love. Before their romance can blossom, she is kidnapped by a show business family of toads, waylaid by a scheming beetle and betrothed to a befuddled mole. Thumbelina’s journey home is fraught with adventure, but at last she comes to believe that if she follows her heart, nothing is impossible. Music by Barry Manilow. Features the voices of Jodie Benson, Carole Channing and John Hurt.

results.title: Salmonberries
results.creator_credit: Percy Adlon, Eleonore Adlon and A pelemele FILM GmbH Production
results.brief_description: An unusual tale of sexual exploration set against the stark beauty of the Alaskan landscape. The boyish Kotzebue (k.d. Lang in her acclaimed acting debut) and German librarian, Roswitha (Rosel Zech) help each other come to terms with their attraction, and in doing so add a further dimension to their emotional confusion. This film takes the viewer on a journey of discovery and challenges perceptions of identity, alienation, love and sexuality. Co-starring Chuck Connors, Jane Lind, Oscar Kawagley, Wolfgang Steinberg and Christel Merian. Soundtrack by k.d Lang.

results.title: Made for each other
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, David O. Selznick, Selznick International and ABC International
results.brief_description: James Stewart and Carole Lombard star in this romantic drama which ends happily ever after. John and Jane Mason begin their newly wedded life with a series of problems. John’s mother is angry because Jane does not meet her expectations, and John’s boss places enormous pressures on them. They are forced to live in a tiny apartment with Mrs. Mason and struggle to make ends meet. After their baby arrives, they separate as the strain becomes too much for their marriage. However, the baby’s serious illness draws them together again, heals the breach between them and turns John’s mother and boss into allies.

results.title: All dogs go to heaven
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Gary Goldman and Sullivan Bluth Studios Ireland
results.brief_description: Don Bluth, the acclaimed animator of “An American Tail” transports us into a wonderful world of animals and adventure. Featuring the voices of Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise and Loni Anderson. Charlie is a rascal but a hero nevertheless. This canine rogue’s michievious streak gets him into serious trouble until he learns the value of friendship and goodness.

results.title: An American tail: Fievel goes west
results.creator_credit: Simon Wells, Phil Nibbelink, Robert Watts, Steven Spielberg and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Fievel, the brave young mouse from the much loved “An American tail” returns in this Wild West adventure. Life is hard for the Mousekewitz family who struggle to make ends meet and to keep their dreams alive. Tanya wants to become a singer and Fievel wants to be like his hero Wylie Burp. Lured out West by crafty Cat R. Waul, Fievel uncovers a dastardly plot to turn new settlers into mouse burgers. With the help of his cat friend Tiger and the feared Wylie Burp, Fievel saves the day. Features the voices of James Stewart, John Cleese, Dom DeLuise and Amy Irving with Linda Ronstadt singing the song “Dreams to Dream”.

results.title: My father, my master = Padre, padrone.
results.creator_credit: Vittorio Taviani, Paolo Taviani, Guiliani de Negri and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: This brutal film is based on the autobiographical novel of the same name by Gavino Ledda which describes his youth and early adulthood as a shepard in the barren hill region of Sardinia. As a five year old Gavino was forcibly removed from school by his harsh peasant father who treated his eldest son as violently as he had been treated by his father before him. The illiterate Gavino eventually joined the army and educated himself to a point where he could stand up to his father and reject ancestral tradition and expectation. Though influenced greatly by Italian neo-realism, “Padre Padrone” also incorporates elements of fantasy and magical realism to convey the epic sweep of Gavino’s story. The author appears as himself in the prologue and epilogue. Both harrowing and deeply humanist, “Padre Padrone” richly deserved the Palme D’Or it won at Cannes in 1977.

results.title: The Strange love of Martha Ivers
results.creator_credit: Lewis Milestone, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Kirk Douglas made his film debut and Barbara Stanwyck starred as the malevolent Martha Ivers in this melodrama cum thriller which engages the viewer until its gripping climax. A strong supporting cast includes Lizabeth Scott, Van Heflin and Judith Anderson. Martha Ivers is a wicked but powerful woman who runs the town of Iverson after inheriting the family fortune. However, Martha has a deadly secret which threatens to ruin her life. As a teenager, Martha was responsible for the murder of her domineering Aunt so she could elope with her lover and the past has a way of catching up her despite her efforts to keep it buried.
